alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Gilmer; Lumpkin; Pickens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:14PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Lumpkin, southeastern Gilmer, northern Dawson, northeastern Pickens, southwestern Union and southeastern Fannin Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 914 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Cartecay, or 9 miles northeast of Jasper, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dahlonega, Jasper, Dawsonville, Ellijay, East Ellijay, Suches, Amicalola Falls State Park, Sequoyah Lake, Camp Merrill, Juno, Fausett Lake, Springer Mountain Shelter, Len Foote Hike Inn, Cartecay, Black Gap Shelter, Lake Tamarack, Auraria, Stover Creek Shelter, Hawk Mountain Shelter and Nimblewill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central Georgia.
